title.justification: The title 'Conformal Inverse Optimization' accurately reflects the core concept presented in the paper, which revolves around inverse optimization and the novel conformal approach introduced.
title.quote: 'In this paper, we first show that the classic IO pipeline may generate decisions that are low-quality and misaligned with human intuition. We next propose conformal IO...'

extractions.description: The paper introduces a novel approach in inverse optimization by proposing 'conformal inverse optimization'. It addresses the limitations of classic IO by learning an uncertainty set for unknown parameters and applying robust optimization to improve decision quality and alignment with human perception.

type.justification: The paper focuses on introducing a theoretical framework for inverse optimization and provides mathematical proofs for its performance guarantees.
type.quote: 'Under mild assumptions, we show that our method enjoys provable guarantees on solution quality...'

name.justification: The primary research field is Optimization, specifically in the context of inverse optimization and robust optimization.
name.quote: 'Inverse optimization has been increasingly used to estimate unknown parameters in an optimization model based on decision data.'

name.justification: The paper discusses inverse optimization as a framework that borrows elements from Supervised Learning for parameter estimation.
name.quote: 'Inverse optimization (IO) is a supervised learning approach that fits parameters in an optimization model to decision data.'

name.justification: The paper presents a new approach that integrates robust optimization into the inverse optimization pipeline to address uncertainty in parameter estimation.
name.quote: '...we propose conformal IO, which first learns an uncertainty set from decision data and then solves a robust optimization model with the learned uncertainty set to prescribe decisions.'
